instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: not backlight, I tried  screen  good problem persists, fuse bad not short in the fuse, some more measures before just changing the fuse? I'm scared just change the fuse and damage the good screen  :cry: or is that not possible?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: Post diode mode to ground on both pins of D9701; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message:
PIN 2 D9701= 0.62    PIN 1 D9701=0.44.    w/o
pin 2 D9701= 0.62.    PIN 2  D9701=0.44  w

If there is a lcd or motherboard problem, how much would it give in diode mode?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message:
Not bad values, you can try changing the fuse.
If burn again, change U7701; can you see any corrosion between its balls now?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: I already changed the fuse, and it did not burn.not see any corrosion between its balls,change U9701?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: I forgot to ask, do you get image at least?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: yes image on internal display without backlight

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: Post all voltages for Q9706 and D9701.
